1054206419140927488.text: All that said, these sentiments are not going to prevent me from retweeting this every time the Dodgers trail in a World Series game.https://twitter.com/piersmorgan/status/242303672569188354 …

1054209688097574912.text: Oh god that series. For the longest time this was my second most vivid memory of the Dodgers in the playoffs. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iD0mRZ2B37Y … https://twitter.com/adrian_pizano30/status/1054207536490995712 …

1054211272202428417.text: That was my freshman year of college, and the dorm room next to mine had two Mets fans in it and invited their Mets fan friends over. My feed was 15 seconds behind theirs, and I knew something REALLY BAD was about to happen. But I still wasn't prepared.

1054210033087471616.text: The left field pavilion benches were taken apart and passed up and over the back railing. It was nuts. First time they sold beer out there for years. Next night no beer. Lol

1054214571001446400.text: we were probably bitching about it on SAS

1054234559984807936.text: I’ve wanted to throw the remote at the TV screen only a few times in my life. Kent and Drew getting thrown out on the same play was one of them. What was Drew thinking?

1054211741528145920.text: I have yet to see anything like it since, so I don't think anything could prepare you. Ultimate playoff Dodgers moment.

1054211990229442560.text: I took a long lunch from work that day to watch part of the game, and after that play I ordered a few more beers and made it an even longer lunch. That was something
